metadata.title: Wednesday, 2nd March, 2022
metadata.session: FIRST SESSION OF THE THIRTEENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to procure beds and furniture for the old and new Lundazi District Hospitals; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines and Minerals Development
parts: (a) how many companies were issued with exploration licences, countrywide, from 2010 to 2020;
(b) what the companies were exploring for;
(c) how many explorations were successful as of October, 2021; and
(d) what the findings at (c), were.

questions.minister: Minister of Energy what measures the Government is taking to attract and retain experienced electrical engineers at Zesco Limited, to prevent brain drain.

parts: (a) when the construction of the Yeta School of Nursing in Sesheke District will commence;
(b) whether the contractor for the project has been engaged;
(c) what the total cost of the project is; and
(d) what the time frame for the completion of the project is.
(a) why the District Commissioners who were relieved of their duties in November, 2021, have been removed from the payroll;
(b) whether the act is not in contravention of the Constitution of Zambia;
(c) if so, what measures are being taken to address the issue; and
(d) when the District Commissioners will be paid their terminal benefits.

questions.minister: Minister of Water Development and Sanitation
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to sink boreholes in Kabendwe area in Chitunda Ward in Chienge Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and
(c) what the cause of the delay in commencing the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Water Development and Sanitation
parts: (a) why the construction of the Kafulafuta Dam in Bwana Mukubwa Parliamentary Constituency has stalled;
(b) when the construction works will resume;
(c) what the total cost of the project is; and
(d) what the time frame for the completion of the outstanding works is.

questions.minister: Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to set up industries in Luangwa District; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to transfer the Mushindamo District Administrative Centre to Musaka Chiefdom which has high economic potential compared to the current location; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) what measures are being taken to ensure that the agriculture sector benefits from the linkages between the country’s education system and industry; and
(b) what measures are being taken to reduce the country’s dependence on maize.

questions.minister: Minister of Labour and Social Security what measures the Government is taking to address the following in the mining sector, countrywide
parts: (a) verbal abuse of workers by foreign investors;
(b) poor salaries for workers;
(c) long working hours;
(d) foreigners doing jobs that can be done by Zambians; and
(e) general poor conditions of service for Zambian workers.
(a) when the three newly constructed mini-hospitals in Ngabwe District will become operational; and
(b) how many health workers will be deployed to each hospital.

questions.minister: Minister of Water Development and Sanitation
parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to provide clean water to the residents of the following townships in Bwana Mkubwa Parliamentary Constituency:
(i) Upper Ndeke; and (ii) Katondo;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) what the specific plans are; and
(d) if there are no such plans, why. __________________________
